"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533b2ea96368726289340300#post_533b2ea96368726289340300
Yes there are, PVC being one of them, the thing is though they do so very poorly. If you wanted plastic wires they would need to be huge in order to be able to flow enough to power even something small. Also the wires would get very hot due to the resistance and, well they would not be wires for long.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533b36c96368724ee2520200#post_533b36c96368724ee2520200
Eh, I'd have to say life is boring more than miserable.  Same thing day in day out and very little things that are unique or events that are truly unique.  It's like a crayon set of nothing but different shades of grey.  Sure you can make art out of just using greys, but would I would kill to have a blue or red once in a while. . Wait. I'm getting too metaphorical; what I mean by this is I disagree about life being miserable, but personally I think it's just boring cause most of what we experience is nothing unique or exciting and I'd personally would like some excitement once in a while.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Oh man, Break Stuff has one of the simplest guitar tabs I have ever seen, the tabs played during the verses are literally 2 notes, the chorus is only slightly more complicated but can easily be played by almost anyone who has even the slightest idea how to play a guitar.

I predict, China will be a flash in the pan.
It's not the future of capitalism, it's new socialism and it will always have the issues socialism always has. <- not saying it's automatically bad, just that there are distinct disadvantages.

Also, Japan's GDP per capita is not that good. It's about as good as France's.
